channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2025021286
item.description:
Report X-2025021286

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: Muscel Shoals
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Norfolk Southern reported and odor coming from tank car ETCX29060. Upon inspection by a contractor the cause of the leak was excessive Thread Tape on the closure plug that did not allow for secondary closure to be secured. There was a small amount of product found between the primary and secondary closure, possibly from loading operations.
